title: 'An injury destroyed my dance career – but travel inspired a new way of life'
text:
A new passion saved Naomi Annand after her cherished ballet career ended in injury and anguish

It was early morning on Koh Phangan’s Haad Rin beach and I was alone, sitting on the sand, looking out into the vast emptiness of the sea. For someone who up to that point had lived a life largely within the confines of an institution, this great unbounded space felt like a mirror being held up to a life which had suddenly become unbounded, unmoored, unnavigable.

I was 21 years old and I was grieving. My ballet career had ended abruptly three weeks earlier, and my first reaction had been to run to the travel agent and buy myself a round-the-world ticket. First stop: wild Koh Phangan, a place as different...
